name: Kepler-359
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-359 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-359 is a star with 1.085 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.09 times its radius. It is located 4899.58 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-359 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-359 b

Kepler-359 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 25.56 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-359.

The mass of Kepler-359 b is 19.87 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-359 b is 3.53 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-359 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-359 c

Kepler-359 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.31 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 57.69 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-359.

The mass of Kepler-359 c is 31.96 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-359 c is 4.3 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-359 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-359 d

Kepler-359 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.37 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 77.10 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-359.

The mass of Kepler-359 d is 27.01 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-359 d is 4.01 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-359 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-359, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
